events.name: Study Reveals Impact of Heat on Fetal Health in Gambia
events.wd_label: Study Reveals Impact of Heat on Fetal Health in Gambia
events.wd_description: A study found that rising temperatures in the Gambia led to increased fetal heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta among women working in fields, highlighting the risks of heat stress for pregnant women and their unborn children.
events.description: A study found that rising temperatures in the Gambia led to increased fetal heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta among women working in fields, highlighting the risks of heat stress for pregnant women and their unborn children.

events.name: Study Findings on Fetal Health
events.wd_description: The study observed that as temperatures rose, fetuses of women working in fields in the Gambia exhibited increased heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta, raising concerns about heat stress during pregnancy.
events.description: The study observed that as temperatures rose, fetuses of women working in fields in the Gambia exhibited increased heart rates and decreased blood flow to the placenta, raising concerns about heat stress during pregnancy.

events.name: Global Heat Exposure Concerns
events.wd_description: The study's findings emphasize the risks posed by extreme heat exposure, which is expected to affect hundreds of millions of people, including pregnant women, even if global temperatures stay below the 1.5°C limit.
events.description: The study's findings emphasize the risks posed by extreme heat exposure, which is expected to affect hundreds of millions of people, including pregnant women, even if global temperatures stay below the 1.5°C limit.

events.name: Potential Explanations for Heat Stress Effects
events.wd_label: Potential Explanations for Heat Stress Effects
events.wd_description: Researchers suggested that heat stress in pregnant women may result from dehydration due to sweating and the diversion of blood and oxygen from the placenta to the skin to cool the body.
events.description: Researchers suggested that heat stress in pregnant women may result from dehydration due to sweating and the diversion of blood and oxygen from the placenta to the skin to cool the body.

events.name: Annexation of Ukrainian Regions by Russia
events.wd_label: Annexation of Ukrainian Regions by Russia
events.wd_description: Russia formally annexed four Ukrainian regions, sparking international condemnation and prompting Ukraine to pursue an accelerated bid to join NATO.
events.description: Russia formally annexed four Ukrainian regions, sparking international condemnation and prompting Ukraine to pursue an accelerated bid to join NATO.

events.name: Annexation Ceremony
events.wd_description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed "accession treaties" with Moscow-installed leaders from four occupied Ukrainian regions at a ceremony in the Kremlin.
events.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed "accession treaties" with Moscow-installed leaders from four occupied Ukrainian regions at a ceremony in the Kremlin.

events.name: Ukraine's NATO Bid
events.wd_description: In response to the annexation, Ukraine launched a fast-track bid to join NATO, with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy describing Ukraine as a "de-facto" member of the security bloc.
events.description: In response to the annexation, Ukraine launched a fast-track bid to join NATO, with President Volodymyr Zelenskiy describing Ukraine as a "de-facto" member of the security bloc.

events.name: International Reactions
events.wd_description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg condemned Russia's annexation as the "most serious escalation since the start of the war," while noting that NATO membership decisions lie with the bloc's 30 members.
events.description: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg condemned Russia's annexation as the "most serious escalation since the start of the war," while noting that NATO membership decisions lie with the bloc's 30 members.

events.name: Explosions at Russian Airbases Following Ukrainian Drone Strikes
events.wd_label: Explosions at Russian Airbases Following Ukrainian Drone Strikes
events.wd_description: Two Russian airbases, located far from the frontlines, were hit by explosions, apparently due to Ukrainian drone strikes targeting bombers used by Russia in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.
events.description: Two Russian airbases, located far from the frontlines, were hit by explosions, apparently due to Ukrainian drone strikes targeting bombers used by Russia in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.

events.name: Drone Strikes on Russian Airbases
events.wd_description: Ukrainian drones reportedly targeted Russian airbases, causing explosions at facilities used by bombers involved in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.
events.description: Ukrainian drones reportedly targeted Russian airbases, causing explosions at facilities used by bombers involved in attacks on Ukraine's electrical grid.

events.name: Damage and Casualties
events.wd_description: The explosions damaged two Russian airplanes, and another explosion at Dyagilevo military airbase resulted in three deaths and five injuries after a fuel truck exploded.
events.description: The explosions damaged two Russian airplanes, and another explosion at Dyagilevo military airbase resulted in three deaths and five injuries after a fuel truck exploded.

events.name: Kremlin's Response
events.wd_description: The Kremlin confirmed that President Vladimir Putin had been briefed on the incidents, occurring on the same day he reopened the Crimean Bridge, previously damaged in an explosion.
events.description: The Kremlin confirmed that President Vladimir Putin had been briefed on the incidents, occurring on the same day he reopened the Crimean Bridge, previously damaged in an explosion.

events.name: DOE Funding for Domestic Battery Manufacturing and Mineral Processing
events.wd_label: DOE Funding for Domestic Battery Manufacturing and Mineral Processing
events.wd_description: The U.S. Department of Energy selected 20 companies to receive a combined $2.8 billion for projects to expand domestic battery manufacturing and mineral processing to support EV transition.
events.description: The U.S. Department of Energy selected 20 companies to receive a combined $2.8 billion for projects to expand domestic battery manufacturing and mineral processing to support EV transition.

events.name: Selected Projects
events.wd_description: DOE announced 21 projects across a dozen states focusing on the extraction and processing of lithium, graphite, and other battery materials, along with component manufacturing and demonstration projects.
events.description: DOE announced 21 projects across a dozen states focusing on the extraction and processing of lithium, graphite, and other battery materials, along with component manufacturing and demonstration projects.

events.name: American Battery Technology Project
events.wd_description: American Battery Technology will receive $57.7 million to develop a commercial-scale facility to demonstrate a new process for manufacturing battery cathode grade lithium hydroxide near Tonopah, Nevada.
events.description: American Battery Technology will receive $57.7 million to develop a commercial-scale facility to demonstrate a new process for manufacturing battery cathode grade lithium hydroxide near Tonopah, Nevada.

events.name: Piedmont Lithium Project
events.wd_description: Piedmont Lithium will receive $141.7 million to develop a facility in McMinn County, Tennessee, capable of producing 30,000 metric tons per year of lithium hydroxide for the domestic battery and EV market.
events.description: Piedmont Lithium will receive $141.7 million to develop a facility in McMinn County, Tennessee, capable of producing 30,000 metric tons per year of lithium hydroxide for the domestic battery and EV market.

events.name: 6k Inc. Project
events.wd_description: 6k Inc. will receive $50 million to develop domestic production of multiple battery chemistries and demonstrate the ability to recycle end-of-life batteries.
events.description: 6k Inc. will receive $50 million to develop domestic production of multiple battery chemistries and demonstrate the ability to recycle end-of-life batteries.

events.name: Funding Impact
events.wd_description: The funding will support the development of enough battery-grade lithium for 2 million EVs annually and is the first phase of $7 billion provided by the bipartisan infrastructure law.
events.description: The funding will support the development of enough battery-grade lithium for 2 million EVs annually and is the first phase of $7 billion provided by the bipartisan infrastructure law.

events.name: American Battery Material Initiative
events.wd_description: The initiative will coordinate domestic and international efforts to accelerate permitting for critical minerals projects while ensuring environmental commitment and community outreach.
events.description: The initiative will coordinate domestic and international efforts to accelerate permitting for critical minerals projects while ensuring environmental commitment and community outreach.
